subject: Updates Coming
event:
I've sent a new sample chapter from A DANCE WITH DRAGONS and an update on the current status of the book to my webmaster.  Expect them to go up soon, on their respective pages.

It may take a few days.  It is the holidays, after all, and my webmaster has a life and other things to do besides taking care of my site.  (This is the only part of my site that I can actually change myself).  So please be patient.  It won't be long.

Happy New Year, everyone.

(And no, the book's not done.  Didn't I just say that in yesterday's post?)

comments.article: The progress towards completion fills me with glee!  Thanks for the updates :)  Happy New Year to you and yours!

comments.upictitle: Popular series of fiction, fancy, and fact.: The classic madbard
comments.article: THANK YOU. Also, confound you for not yet finishing. Yes, we fans are full of emotional paradoxes.

Thanks George.

BTW - finally started reading Dreamsongs. Damn The Way of Cross and Dragon is a fine piece of work!!

Yes! And the fucked up manipulation of meat(you'll see) in Meathouse Man is nothing short of an imagination light years beyond mine. But now everytime I see a girl out of my league, my mind goes to that room, "just a sink, double bed with sheets that looked dirty even in the dimness, a corpse." Disturbing? Yes. But isn't that the point?
comments.subject: Meathouse Man

comments.article:
The book will be done when it is done. I think we as the fans are so fortunate to actually be in this close of contact with you, the author. Writing takes time. Life happens in between writing; as it should happen for you.

I salute you, Mr. Martin. May you and yours have a very happy and blessed 2008.
Yay! I can't wait to read it!

Yay! It's like having Christmas all over again :) Thanks for the updates.

On a related note, just finished volume 1 of Dreamsongs, and I'm in awe. Also, I've been trying to hunt down "The Lonely Songs of Laren Dorr" for years, and it was marvelous to get to read it again.
I totally agree, and Volume II expands even more!
comments.subject: Dreamsongs

comments.article:
That is a damn fine hat you're wearing in your user picture.

Also: Yay! :)

Nice avatar. :)

comments.upictitle: Madam Lulzy the Great: Deedlit Relaxing
comments.article: Har de har har! :P

Haha thank you very much for the sample. What percent are you done with the novel?

Can't wait to read it.
Happy New Year, George! :-)

HAPPY NEW YEAR!

Can't wait for the update and new sample chapter. :)
I feel the same.... whenever I'm bored/sick of real life, I flip to the Tyrion POV's in any of the books and I get carried away to Westeros all over again.
comments.subject: Yes!

comments.article: I don't get these fanboys with their rude comments. They can't be over 16 years old. "Gimme gimme, mine mine, now now!!" I just finished Dreamsongs Volume II, and I must say I want more. Anyone craving a fix til DWD needs to read Meathouse Man, Road to San Breta, Sandkings, The Second Kind of Loneliness, With Morning Comes Mistfall, And Seven Times Never Kill Man, The Way of Cross and Dragon, The Monkey Treatment, The Pear Shaped Man(these last two gave me trouble sleeping), The Skin Trade, Portraits of His Children and my most intense favorite, the two Tuf stories. And these aren't all!! I was obsessed with DWD also, but right now I want more Tuf stories!! We all know that when DWD comes, we'll finish it in two days and start bugging Mr. Martin for the next..... Please, Mr Martin, do things at your own pace. Dreamsongs is brilliant. I loved exploring your sci-fi side, being a fan of Charles Sheffield, L.E. Modesitt and Poul Anderson. It only makes me appreciate your skill even more, and I hope one day you will consider returning to sci-fi. Maybe in the last I&F book Bran finds an ancient spacecraft wreckage beyond the wall, explaining everyone's real origin?:) By the way, I'm planning to meet you in Blacksburg in March, my father and I are huge fans, not just of you but fantasy and sci-fi in general. Thanks!!!
comments.subject: Everything GRRM

comments.article:
Happy New Year!
Best wishes.
You're the best ever. Happy New Year!

Yeees!

Thank you! I love you!

*waits patiently*

It's not done? How come you haven't finished it between yesterday and today? Huh? HUH?!

*ducks and tries to be patiently for the update*

comments.upictitle: Madam Lulzy the Great: Deedlit Relaxing
comments.article:
I'll have you know that I'm on a crusade to get everyone I know reading your books!

I've recruited nearly ten so far! And they're hooked, I tell ya, hooked! I let them borrow A Game of Thrones for a little while, and a few weeks later they're blazin' through, all current four sitting happily on their bookshelves.
The new sample is just what I needed. Can't wait for it to be posted!
comments.subject: YES!

comments.article:
Thank you for your hard work. Will read with pleasure ^^
Happy New Year to you too. :)

~Syn
Oh, thank you!  What a great Happy New Year present!!!  I love you!
I was hoping for a 2008 Boston Pizza Crawl at Boskone but I will settle for ADWD chapter instead. Happy New Years! Cant wait for the Pats to hurry up and just win the Superbowl already...
comments.subject: Its no pizza crawl but I'll take it....

comments.article:
... we've just got A FEAST FOR CROWS published. This is good, as I have a new doses of A Son of Ice and Fire before I go mad; and bad, as I can't help but think that if it took them ~1 year to translate and publish this one, it's gonna be ages before DANCE falls in my hands...

Nevertheless, happy new year to everyone!
comments.subject: In Spain...

comments.article:
Did you know that George will be visiting Spain in July of this year? We'll be going to Semana Negra, Madrid, Barcelona and perhaps a few other cities. HIs publishers have warned him that since 2001, the first time he visited Spain he's become quite popular, and they'll be working him much harder than in 2001. Which means I'll be visiting many more museums and places of interest by myself. Good thing I only saw a small portion of the Prado when we first visited! Semana Negra is a unique experience in a beautiful town, the mix of guests is highly eclectic, and there's a pizza restaurant in Gijon we loved so much I wanted to convince the owner to send a younger son over to start a restaurant here.

I hope we'll get the chance to meet you during our visit.
comments.subject: Re: In Spain...

comments.article: Happy New Year!!!
